attribute.description: Set to indicate clock-start/instruction execution in cache-contained or chip-contained mode will be managed by runn Provided by: platform (FW platforms init to OFF)
Bitvector of which threads to sreset via decrementer in cache-contained or chip-contained mode Bitmap: 0bxxxx00000000 T0 -------'||| T1 --------'|| T2 ---------'| T3 ----------'

Base number of clock cycles to execute in runn mode In cache-contained, this is the base number of clock cycles to execute per quad In chip-contained, this is the base number of clock cycles to execute per chip Consumed by: p10_runn HWP (Cronus platform only, chip/cache-contained mode) Provided by: platform (FW platforms init to 0)

Number of clock cycles to offset each chip from the base value in chip/cache-contained Consumed by: p10_runn HWP (Cronus platform only, chip/cache-contained mode) Provided by: platform (FW platforms init to 0)
Number of clock cycles to offset each quad from the base value in cache-contained Consumed by: p10_runn HWP (Cronus platform only, cache-contained mode) Provided by: platform (FW platforms init to 0)
Number of clock cycles to offset each core within a quad in cache-contained Consumed by: p10_runn HWP (Cronus platform only, cache-contained mode) Provided by: platform (FW platforms init to 0)

Perform RUNN configuration checks after starting RUNN counter(s): - confirm RUNN clocks are running - (if chip-contained) confirm all clocks started in-phase by comparing clock controller phase-counter values captured at clock start Note: this may compromise cycle-reproduceability!
Use QME-sourced, cycle-reproducible timebase ("high-precision" mode) instead of PC-internal "standalone" mode timebase (also cycle-reproducible).
Stop OPCG RUNN counter and clocks when a checkstop occurs.
Master seed used to seed the RNG for generating thread seeds for exercisers.

Specify a core whose exerciser thread seeds should be duplicated across all other cores. Example: ATTR_RUNN_CORE_SEED_SELECT=CORE05, then when generating exerciser seeds, every other core would first seed the RNG w/ ATTR_RUNN_MASTER_SEED and then discard values until CORE05 before generating per-thread seeds.
The default behavior is to randomize each core independently by using ATTR_RUNN_CORE_SEED_SELECT=RANDOM.
